akn:section.akn:heading: Duties and functions of Secretary of the Interior and Secretary of Agriculture

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Programs and projects; conditions of employment; regulations; use of facilities by educational institutions

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Programs and projects; conditions of employment; regulations; use of facilities by educational institutions In carrying out this subchapter, the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture shall— Costs for operations maintenance, and staffing of Corps camp facilities during periods of use by non-Corps programs as well as any liability for personal injury or property damage stemming from such use shall be the responsibility of the entity or organization using the facility and shall not be a responsibility of the Secretaries or the Corps.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Use of unoccupied Federal facilities and equipment

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Use of unoccupied Federal facilities and equipment Existing but unoccupied Federal facilities and surplus or unused equipment (or both), of all types including military facilities and equipment, shall be utilized for the purposes of the Corps, where appropriate and with the approval of the Federal agency involved. To minimize transportation costs, Corps members shall be employed on conservation projects as near to their places of residence as is feasible.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Contracts for the operation of projects

akn:content.akn:p: (c) Contracts for the operation of projects The Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture may contract with any public agency or organization or any private nonprofit agency or organization which has been in existence for at least five years for the operation of any Youth Conservation Corps project.
